global_attributes.title: SWOT Discharge Prior Information
global_attributes.summary: All the necessary prior information to produce SWOT discharge; including gauges, hydrologic model output, and geomorphic attributes from the geoBAM prior generation method.
global_attributes.keywords: Rivers/Streams, Discharge/Flow, SWOT, Stream Gauges, model input, n, A0, r, slope
global_attributes.keywords_vocabulary: NASA Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) Science Keywords
global_attributes.acknowledgement: NASA AIST Program Grant Number 80NSSC22K1487, NASA SWOT Science Team Grant Numbers: 80NSSC20K1143, 80NSSC20K1141, 80NSSC20K1340 and CNES SWOT TOSCA fund for the SWOT DAHM project. Additional support from PO.DAAC and the SWOT mission.
global_attributes.institution: NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) Physical Oceanography Distributed Active Archive Center (PO.DAAC)/University of Massachusetts Amherst (UMass)/Ohio State University
global_attributes.project: Surface Water And Ocean Topography Discharge Algorithms Working Group (SWOT DAWG)
global_attributes.license: Issued under Creative Commons CC BY 4.0: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

reach_id.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD:  id of each reach. The format of none the id is as follows: CBBBBBRRRRT where C = Continent (the first number of the Pfafstetter basin code), B = Remaining Pfafstetter basin codes up to level 6, R = Reach id (assigned sequentially within a level 6 basin starting at the downstream end working upstream, T = Type (1 – river, 3 – lake on river, 4 – dam or waterfall, 5 – unreliable topology, 6 – ghost reach)

x.comment: longitude of the reach center decimal ranging from 180°E to 180°W

y.comment: latitude of the reach center decimal ranging from 90°S to 90°N

river_name.comment: all river names associated with a reach. If there are multiple names for a reach they are listed in alphabetical order and separated by a semicolon.

node_id.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD:  id of each node. The format of the id is as follows: CBBBBBRRRRNNNT where C = Continent (the first number of the Pfafstetter basin code), B = Remaining Pfafstetter basin code up to level 6, R = Reach id (assigned sequentially within a level 6 basin starting at the downstream end working upstream), N = Node id (assigned sequentially within a reach starting at the downstream end working upstream), T = Type (1 – river, 3 – lake on river, 4 – dam or waterfall, 5 – unreliable topology, 6 – ghost node)

reach_id.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD: id of the reach each node is associated with. The format of the id is as follows: CBBBBBRRRRT where C = Continent (the first number of the Pfafstetter basin code), B = Remaining Pfafstetter basin codes up to level 6, R = Reach id (assigned sequentially within a level 6 basin starting at the downstream end working upstream), T = Type (1 – river, 3 – lake on river, 4 – dam or waterfall, 5 – unreliable topology, 6 – ghost reach)

x.comment: longitude of each node ranging from 180°E to 180°W

y.comment: latitude of each node ranging from 90°S to 90°N

river_name.comment: all river names associated with a node. If there are multiple names for a node they are listed in alphabetical order and separated by a semicolon.

num_months.comment: Number of months that monthly values are indexed on

probability.comment: GRADES probability values from the flow duration curve for this cell

flow_duration_q.comment: GRADES discharge values from the flow duration curve for this cell

max_q.comment: GRADES highest discharge value in this cell

monthly_q.comment: GRADES monthly mean discharge time series in this cell

mean_q.comment: GRADES mean discharge value in this cell

min_q.comment: GRADES lowest discharge value in this cell

two_year_return_q.comment: GRADES two year return interval discharge value in this cell

area_estimate_flag.comment: This cell was not a good match. Data has been scaled by difference in flow accumulation area.

comid.comment: ID in the MERIT Hydro system

overwritten_indexes.comment: Indexes of GRADES priors that were overwritten by priors module.

overwritten_source.comment: Source of gauge data that overwrote GRADES priors.

bad_priors.comment: Indexes of invalid gauge priors that were not overwritten.

num_months.comment: Number of months that monthly values are indexed on

mean_q.comment: WBM mean discharge value in this cell

min_q.comment: WBM lowest discharge value in this cell

two_year_return_q.comment: WBM two year return interval discharge value in this cell

area_estimate_flag.comment: This cell was not a good match. Data has been scaled by difference in flow accumulation area.

river_type.comment: river class from Brinkerhoff et al 2019

overwritten_indexes.comment: Indexes of geoBAM priors that were overwritten
Indexes of geoBAM priors that were overwritten

num_days.comment: Number of days that daily values are indexed on
